channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-9445] Snapshots should create column family dirs for empty regions
item.description:
Currently, taking a snapshot will not create the family directory under a region if the family does not have any files in it.

Subsequent verification fails because of this. There is some logic in the SnapshotTestingUtils.confirmSnapshotValid() to deal with empty family directories, but I think we should create the family directories regardless of whether there are any hfiles referencing them.

I think this is important for 0.96.0.
item.summary: Snapshots should create column family dirs for empty regions

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Attaching a simple patch which changes the hfile referencing to not skip creating family dir in case there are no files to reference.

The problem is SnapshotTestingUtils.confirmSnapshotValid() that is not using the SnapshotReferenceUtil.visitRegionStoreFiles() but is trying to loop through the dir...
The MasterSnapshotVerifier in the main code path will never fail for that reason.

also the patch doesn't contain the fix for the online code path HRegion.addRegionToSnapshot()

The problem is SnapshotTestingUtils.confirmSnapshotValid() that is not using the SnapshotReferenceUtil.visitRegionStoreFiles()

I though that when taking the snapshot, SnapshotReferenceUtil.visitRegionStoreFiles() will already be run from the snapshot itself, so that the test does not have to run this a second time.

also the patch doesn't contain the fix for the online code path HRegion.addRegionToSnapshot()

Will add that.
Fixed online snapshots as well.

v2 looks good to me.

but I'm +0, I don't think think doing the mkdir is the solution.
The problem is that confirmSnapshotValid() that tries to verify a snapshot in a wrong way.
For me the fix is just removing the assertTrue() that expects the dir and use the listStatus (with a fix for the NPE).


  assertTrue("Expected to find: " + familyDir + ", but it doesn't exist", fs.exists(familyDir));

  // make sure we have some files references

  assertTrue(fs.listStatus(familyDir).length > 0);

These tests that are not using SnapshotReferenceUtil making assumptions on the fs layout are the ones that are blocking HBASE-7987

I don't think think doing the mkdir is the solution ... These tests that are not using SnapshotReferenceUtil making assumptions on the fs layout are the ones that are blocking HBASE-7987

I think the correct solution for this is not even HBASE-7987, but finishing up hardlinks in hdfs, and properly creating snapshot files sharing the same actual blocks with the hfiles. Given that we don't have this for now, I think we should replicate the same directory structure (including family dirs) in snapshot dirs. If we end up doing HBASE-7987, this patch will become obsolete, which is fine.

imagining that the confirmSnapshotValid() was written without the assert on fs.exists(familyDir) as it should be...
could you explain why you need the extra family directories?
just to match the /hbase/table layout? (which doesn't have the family dir until after the region is opened)
That "information" is not used/useful to restore or snapshot verification... and is just another extra set calls to the NameNode

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12601685/hbase-9445_v2.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 6 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop1.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.0 profile.

+1 hadoop2.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

-1 javadoc. The javadoc tool appears to have generated 1 warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.snapshot.TestReferenceRegionHFilesTask

This message is automatically generated.

could you explain why you need the extra family directories? just to match the /hbase/table layout? (which doesn't have the family dir until after the region is opened)

We are already replicating the structure of the table directory inside the snapshot, and since those family directories are getting created for stores that have hfiles in them, we should be consistent. Since this only affects stores with no data, I don't expect extra calls to NN would justify not creating the directories.
Matteo Bertozzi I am going to commit this if you are ok with it. wdyt?
Enis Soztutar The Matteo Bertozzi approach seems simpler/cleaner. A one-liner?
Moving it out till agreement.
How about something like this patch. It does not change the way family dirs are created, but we do not fail on empty regions.

Not sure to understand the patch.
visitRegions() iterates only on regions with files in it, so you get the same regions that you get from visitTableStoreFiles().. since it iterates only on region files..
if the region does not contain any files, because it is empty, then the visitor will not see the region at all, thus it will fail because snapshotRegions will not contain the empty region.

oh right, i read visitRegions() wrong.
ok for me, do you want include the test that was in the first patch?

This message is automatically generated.

do you want include the test that was in the first patch?

That test fails even with this patch. The reason is that we are snapshotting a table with a single region, and with no store files. The snapshot region will not contain a directory for the family (as per issue description) hence the validation still fails.
Moving out of 0.98.0. Put back if ready before RC.
Moving out of 0.98.1

v4 looks ok to me

Andrew Purtell this is a test code fix, are you ok with committing it to 0.98?
Committed to 0.98 as well. Thanks Andrew.
